instruction: What are the evaluation metrics used to assess the prediction accuracy of the machine learning models in the study comparing field and laboratory wet measurements for soil organic carbon (SOC) prediction?
Output:
The evaluation metrics used to assess the prediction accuracy of the machine learning models in the study comparing field and laboratory wet measurements for soil organic carbon (SOC) prediction are R-CV(2) and RMSEPcv.

R-CV(2) refers to the coefficient of determination for cross-validation, which measures the proportion of the variance in the predicted SOC values that can be explained by the model. It ranges from 0 to 1, with a higher value indicating a better fit of the model to the data.

RMSEPcv stands for root mean square error of prediction for cross-validation. It measures the average difference between the predicted SOC values and the actual SOC values in the validation dataset. A lower value indicates a higher prediction accuracy of the model.

These metrics were used to compare the prediction accuracy of different machine learning algorithms (partial least squares regression and support vector machine regression) and different measurement methods (field measurement and laboratory wet measurement) in different spectral ranges (visible, near-infrared, and visible-near infrared).
